programme.title: Me and Orson Welles
programme.desc: New York, 1937. Richard (Zac Efron) lucks into a starring role in Orson Welles's production of Julius Caesar.

programme.title: Fandango
programme.desc: Five young men about to graduate from college, take one last trip before facing their lives as adults.

programme.title: Mary Reilly
programme.desc: An innocent domestic worker comes to realize her employer and benefactor, Dr. Jekyll, is hiding a horrifying secret involving his curious assistant.

programme.title: Runaway
programme.desc: A futuristic cop who works on broken robots discovers a plan to program them with artificial intelligence for murder, with his own son on the list.

programme.title: Blue-Eyed Butcher
programme.desc: Based on the shocking true story about a beautiful young wife and mother accused of the brutal murder of her seemingly perfect husband.

programme.title: Sister Mary Explains It All
programme.desc: A confrontation between three former students and a nun forever changes their lives as the students turn the dogmatic nun's teachings on their head.

programme.title: Fresh Horses
programme.desc: Jewel married a gun-totin' good ol' boy Green, with whom she has ostensibly never had sex. But when she meets rich kid Matt, it's love at first sight.

programme.title: Surrender, Dorothy
programme.desc: Hoping to learn more about her daughter Sara after her sudden death, Natalie retreats to the beach house where Sara's friends are summering.

programme.title: Lost in Yonkers
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy/drama that follows the escapades and tragedies of an unusual family in 1942 Yonkers.

programme.title: Raising Waylon
programme.desc: A restaurateur (Thomas Gibson) and a photographer (Poppy Montgomery) learn surprising things about themselves while taking care of their 9-year-old godchild.

programme.title: Double Platinum
programme.desc: Years after she abandoned her baby girl, a famous singer must face her now teenage daughter and repair their complicated relationship.

programme.title: To Write Love on Her Arms
programme.desc: Based on the life of Renee Yohe, who battled drugs, depression, and issues, that led to the founding of the charity group To Write Love on Her Arms.

programme.title: 28 Days
programme.desc: A disastrous drunken episode lands a successful New York journalist in rehab where she encounters a bizarre assortment of characters and rituals.

programme.title: Running With Scissors
programme.desc: A teenage boy is "adopted" by his mother's wacky therapist and must cope with an extended family of eccentrics.

programme.title: Race the Sun
programme.desc: A teacher at a high school in Hawaii and her previously unmotivated students find new purpose through a solar-powered science fair project.

programme.title: To Gillian on Her 37th Birthday
programme.desc: After the death of his loving wife, David is torn by grief, and has been fixating on her spirit. Now he must let go of her in order to move on.

programme.title: Miracle on the Mountain: The Kincaid Family Story
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film recounts a family's struggle for survival after their private plane crashes on their way to a cabin in the mountains.

programme.title: Into Thin Air: Death on Everest
programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye
programme.desc: When an American pilot meets a serene Jewish girl of Spanish descent during World War II, their diverse backgrounds might mean love could never work.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Nadine
programme.desc: While recovering sexy photos of herself from a dishonest photographer, a woman witnesses a murder and finds herself at the center of a conspiracy.

programme.title: Wilder Napalm
programme.desc: Sparks fly when two brothers, a workaday joe and a circus performer, who possess pyrokinetic minds, start fires and vie for the love of one hot woman.

programme.title: Finding Graceland
programme.desc: A grieving and guilt-ridden recent widower finds himself on a road trip to Memphis after picking up a hitchhiker who claims he’s Elvis Presley.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy father’s yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: After a volcano erupts on a South Sea island, a fallen priest and three convicts race to save the lives of children in a mountaintop leper colony.

programme.title: Girls Can Play
programme.desc: A detective investigates the murder of a player on a professional girl's softball team.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: A wealthy Hawaiian pineapple plantation owner and bigoted bully with political ambitions flatly refuses to allow his young sister to marry a native.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Wooed by a Pittsburgh socialite, an idealistic doctor from a mining town is torn between helping his community and lucrative work at an elite clinic.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: An aging New England mayor is defeated in a hard-fought reelection campaign involving shady transactions by both political groups.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: Berserk
programme.desc: Suspicions fall on the imperious ringmistress of a traveling circus when she appears unfazed by a series of mysterious and grisly murders.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Charles Dickens novel, an orphan on the streets of London is welcomed into a household of trained pickpockets.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: California Conquest
programme.desc: A Spanish swashbuckler (Cornel Wilde) and a gunsmith's daughter (Teresa Wright) oppose a Russian plot to annex California.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: The Texan Meets Calamity Jane
programme.desc: Calamity Jane's rightful ownership of a gambling hall is challenged but a Texas lawyer puts up a sensational legal battle to help her stay in charge.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Legend of the Golden Gun
programme.desc: After his family is killed, a quiet, young farmer turns into a deadly gunfighter, dedicating his life to the pursuit of evildoers.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: Hoedown
programme.desc: An ex-movie cowboy (Jack O'Mahoney) and a newswoman (Jeff Donnell) rope bank robbers at a singer's (Eddy Arnold) dude ranch.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: The Crimson Pirate
programme.desc: A pirate gets mixed up in a Caribbean revolution.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: Because someone’s gotta do it, a Texas cattleman takes on the task of cleaning up the wild and lawless Dodge City while courting one of its women.

programme.title: They Won't Believe Me
programme.desc: A faithless husband is charged with a murder he didn't commit.

programme.title: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: A swinging bachelor finds love when he meets a girl immune to his line.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: A bride attempts to turn her six brothers-in-law into gentlemen.

programme.title: Take Me Out to the Ball Game
programme.desc: A beautiful woman takes over a turn-of-the-century baseball team.

programme.title: What Ever Happened To Baby Jane?
programme.desc: Two aging sisters are connected by mutual dependency, jealousy and hatred.

programme.title: What's Up, Doc?
programme.desc: When suitcases are mixed up, a chase across San Francisco follows.

programme.title: Viva Las Vegas!
programme.desc: As he prepares for the Las Vegas Grand Prix, Lucky tries to secure funds for a new engine while winning the affections of a hotel swim instructor.

programme.title: Sergeant York
programme.desc: Recruited to fight in World War I, a Tennessee farmer with deep pacifist beliefs is driven to take up arms when his unit is overwhelmed by Germans.

programme.title: David Copperfield (1935)
programme.desc: Charles Dickens' classic tale of an orphaned boy's fight for happiness.

programme.title: Easy to Love
programme.desc: Williams wins her boss over when she starts an affair with another man.

programme.title: The Goodbye Girl
programme.desc: After her ex leaves and subleases their apartment without warning, an ex-dancer forms an unlikely home with the new tenant, a quirky struggling actor.

programme.title: The Great Race
programme.desc: Set in 1908, dastardly, black-garbed Professor Fate dares the world's greatest hero, The Great Leslie, to race 22,000 miles from New York to Paris.

programme.title: The Americanization of Emily
programme.desc: A black comedy about honor, cowardice and unexpected heroism.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Bowery Bombshell
programme.desc: When one of the Bowery Boys is photographed in front of a bank during a robbery, he becomes a suspect.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Jinx Money
programme.desc: After the Bowery Boys find a dead gambler's money, they're soon pursued by the mob and police.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Live Wires
programme.desc: In the first Bowery Boys film, the boys take on gangsters from a construction company.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: News Hounds
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys become undercover newspaper journalists and investigate a ring of gamblers.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: In Fast Company
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys get into the taxicab business and fight a conniving rival cab company.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Hard Boiled Mahoney
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys accidentally become private detectives, and their investigation uncovers a fraudulent psychic.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Angels in Disguise
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys go undercover to catch some unruly gangsters.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Smuggler's Cove
programme.desc: After one of the Bowery Boys inherits an estate on Long Island, the crew face a German gang of smugglers.

programme.title: Abbott and Costello Meet Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Abbott and Costello are on an island with deadly pirates.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Cowboy Ross Bodine decides to join his buddy in robbing a bank to finance a comfortable retirement.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett meets a woman who helps him reopen the last cold case his father investigated before dying.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, the team hunts a serial killer who mimics murders from a cult slasher film; Jerry is abducted by counterfeiters.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a sugar refinery explodes, the CSIs make a shocking discovery about one of the employees.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When the investigation of a millionaire's death leads the CSIs to an elite dating service, Ryan poses as a wealthy businessman to expose the matchmaker's lies.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: After a fire hydrant washes away evidence, the team must re-create a bizarre double murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A young roller derby star is found dead in a locker room; the team investigates the murder.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy captain is murdered during an appearance on a local radio show; Pride's daughter comes home to talk about her plans for the future.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Agent Brody sees a connection between the case of a sailor struck by a party bus and the death of her sister; the team gets ready for the city's St. Patrick's Day celebrations.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Pride's daughter is attacked on campus, the team finds a surveillance van loaded with pictures of the special agent's every move.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates when a Navy lieutenant is murdered during a traditional funeral procession in the French Quarter honoring the recently deceased.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy lieutenant dies during a secret visit to a general's hotel, agent Pride and the team are asked to break protocol for the investigation.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: While visiting her family's restaurant in the French Quarter, a Navy culinary specialist is the target of an explosion; in D.C., Brody tracks a lead in the Gen. Leak case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS teams with Homeland Security when the murder of a Navy master diver is discovered to be linked to the chatter concerning a foreign attack on the city.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team discovers a mole in the ranks while helping the Department of Homeland Security locate 900 pounds of missing explosives that are a threat to New Orleans.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team joins forces with several federal agencies to stop a sniper who has been targeting crowded events in the city; FBI Special Agent Tammy Gregario begins investigating Pride's team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride faces more repercussions from the FBI after he helps a former Navy Intelligence Analyst who is the primary suspect in a multiple homicide case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After the discovery of a petty officer's body inside a sports arena, evidence leads Pride and the NCIS team to a kidnapping case of another petty officer, last seen in Mexico.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS must come to the rescue of one of its own when Sebastian is kidnapped while dining in a restaurant with his mother; Sebastian relies on his gaming skills in a prison break.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS and the FBI investigate a private plane crash in the bayou that killed three sailors; Sonja and Lasalle interview candidates for a job opening on the team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL candidate is murdered weeks before his graduation; Wade seeks Pride's help when her adopted son announces his plan to join the Navy.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A sailor is murdered during a rowdy motorcycle rally in the city; Lasalle seeks personal advice from Gregorio.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After a member of the United States Navy Band is murdered in her home, Pride looks after the victim's nephew, who is the only witness to the crime.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates when a Marine corporal who is an amateur race car driver is in a fatal crash on the track.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride needs to protect a family friend engaged to the prime suspect in an ongoing NCIS and FBI cartel case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Sebastian goes under cover; Patton practices his old gambling skills; Pride and the team embark on a perilous plan to trap Garcia.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Pride travels to a deep-sea oil rig for a murder investigation, the team uncovers a gas leak that's on the verge of causing a catastrophic explosion; Sebastian starts his NCIS special agent training.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSI team must find whoever is trying to kill a couple recently released from jail, whose misdeeds turned them into media darlings.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A kidnapped woman misdials a cell-phone number and begs for help, and the team must figure out the number and person she was trying to call.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team has a long list of suspects, including a victim's wife, a magician and a captain, as members search for the killer of two people on a cruise ship docked in Miami.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress is found dead in her bathtub during her own party, with no shortage of suspects; Horatio tells Delko that he and Marisol plan to wed as soon as possible.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team is on the verge of putting away members of the Mala Noche gang, but the gang's planned hit on Horatio endangers the lives of those close to him.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio mourns the murder of someone close to him as he and the team hunt for the killer; the revelation of the mole's identity jeopardizes the future of the lab.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Delko travel to Brazil in pursuit of Marisol's killer.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When Calleigh is run off the road into a canal, the evidence she is carrying becomes corrupted, so the team must uncover new evidence to solve the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: After a celebrity is murdered at an A-list party, the team uncovers a counterfeiting ring producing $100 bills.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Male models' good looks may have cost them their lives; Natalia's abusive ex-husband begins stalking her at the lab.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A politician supports the use of eminent domain to clean up a neighborhood, and his dead body is later found in an empty house.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Bizarre incidents take place in the CSI lab after the team begins its investigation into the death of a Santeria practitioner.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is decapitated while performing a stunt, and Horatio believes his death was more than just an accident when he learns the hydraulics system had been tampered with.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: While investigating a kidnapping and murder, the team finds a safe with dozens of pictures of missing women; as the team tries to find Boa Vista's kidnapped sister, Horatio must find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new Forensic Pathologist Kam Karimore are drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching as they seek to identify the villain.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious lights are seen in the sky over famous UFO hot-spot Cooper Hill. When a local forest-ranger suffers a strange death the visiting UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible. DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets in their search for the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle. When the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson find themselves drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed where winning comes at any cost.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. But when the leader of the dig is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson soon realise that it's not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead with his wrists slashed and suspicion turns towards a spiritualist church.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a regatta, the body of Rowing Club chairman Guy Sweetman is found bludgeoned and drowned. Bachelor Sweetman was prolifically promiscuous and jealousy would seem to be the motive.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott follow a trail of dead people involved in the collecting of rare orchids.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A four-member syndicate owns a racehorse that two of them are desperate to sell and two of them are determined to keep. When one of them is murdered, Barnaby is on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Barnaby and Sgt. Scott investigate the death of John Ransom in the village of Midsomer Mere. He had just been ejected from a pub for fighting but the post mortem shows a series of burn marks on his skull indicating he may have been subject to electric shock.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Troubled solicitor Nick Turner falls from the roof of his home, is this suicide disguised as murder?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a corporate giant tries to acquire a small but respected relish factory owned and run by a dysfunctional family, a naked body is found in the warehouse.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Deaths follow the discovery of a valuable musical manuscript sold cheaply at an auction.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The wheels are spinning as the world-famous Barrett-Jackson collector car auction descends on Houston, Texas, with bidders duking it out for a chance to take home some of the greatest cars ever seen at jaw-dropping prices.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Featuring incredible restorations and customs cars; Broncos, Beetles, MOPARs, and Mercedes.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Some of the world's greatest cars cross the auction block at Barrett Jackson's 50th anniversary ceremony in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The hottest cars are rolling down the block, causing car enthusiast mayhem like never before.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Scottsdale Auction heats up on Super Saturday as customs, classics and moderns drive across the auction block; from a 1929 Ford Model A custom roadster to a 2020 Ford Shelby, bidding is in full swing with prices soaring into six figures.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Scottsdale Auction is in full swing as the parade of custom cars make their way across the auction block. From 1954 Ford F-100 Pick-Ups to 1971 Chevy Chevelles, there's a custom car out there for everyone at Barrett-Jackson!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson hits the road running as it celebrates 50 years of spectacular cars in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Mike Pihl looks for help from a logging legend; Jason Rygaard faces his biggest test as the new boss; the Harkness crew battles winter storms and vertical terrain in the Cascade Mountains; Wade Etienne goes after valuable hardwood giants.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Brandon Harkness fights his way up a mountainside; Mike Pihl get his 52-ton yarder lodged between trees; Wade Ettiene's Big Mama takes a two-inch steel sawtooth to her face; and Buckin' Billy's son Hogan loses his grip while cutting a tree.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Danny Pihl gambles on horsepower.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard Logging fights to fix a crooked skyline, crossing a deep valley on their longest road yet.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A breakdown forces Jason Rygaard to choose between his crew's safety and finishing the job; Frank Harkness is caught in a whiteout while moving the excavator on a narrow mountainside logging road.

programme.desc: Danny Pihl relies on the experience of veteran cutters Dwayne and Chuck to take down massive old-growth trees; Craig Rygaard discovers son Jason made a catastrophic and costly miscalculation; Frank Harkness races to transport $100,000 worth of logs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard fights the weather while hauling heavy, slick trees on the steepest setting of the season; Danny Pihl and his veteran crew precisely drop 250-foot, old-growth cedars next to a group of cabins.

programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller sends in the original cover art for one of the greatest albums of all time, Rick fights for his right to buy it; some big money bills signed by billionaires Warren Buffett and Charlie Munger make their way across the counter.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Line Drive Pinball Machine comes into the shop; an 1895 Morgan Dollar; Chum oversees a shift at Corey's new bar.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The world's rarest Hot Wheels car, the Beach Bomb 1, comes into the shop; Rick gets creative when checking out an etching by Rembrandt; Chum decides to write his memoirs.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1963 Beatles signed guitar comes into the shop; Corey checks out a 1981 Suzuki motorcycle; Rick make an effort to teach the guys some office etiquette.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An ancient tome believed to hold the secret for turning metals into gold; a costume signed by professional wrestler Macho Man Randy Savage; a half dollar that was supposedly pierced by sharpshooter Annie Oakley; a fancy French gunpowder flask.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A spy pen radio is brought into the shop; a customer brings in a Bruce Springsteen tour jacket; a pair of paintings by motorcycle artist David Mann.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Replica swords signed by "Kill Bill" actor David Carradine; a first-edition of T.S. Eliot's "Four Quartets;" a 1965 Battle of the Bulge board game; a 1920s radium crock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick looks at an 1800s first edition book about the Underground Railroad; a complete set of baseball cards given only to troops during Desert Shield is brought in; Chumlee tries to come up with his own collectible.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A lunar Bible from Apollo 14; a 1930s Buck Rogers Disintegrator Gun; miniature samples of a 1950s kitchen; a 1950s Beetle Bailey original print.

programme.desc: An original Beach Boys surfboard; a magazine feature penned by Mark Twain; an early spirit hydrometer; an original Peter Max painting of the Statue of Liberty.

programme.desc: Rick and Chumlee are drawn to an original "Rocky and Bullwinkle Show" sketch; Rick inspects a possible first edition of Richard Nixon's memoirs; Chumlee tries his hand at wheeling and dealing.

programme.desc: Handwritten math by Albert Einstein; an antique headlamp tester; a prop from the horror movie, "Child's Play;" a pill case that may have belonged to Hollywood legend Carole Lombard.

programme.desc: Kenny feels nostalgic in Koreatown, so he brings along an old friend, which may or may not be a good idea; Brandi and Jarrod sweeten their profit in an unexpected way; Ivy tolerates the big city in an effort to find some name-brand goodies.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Emily brings her mother along; Darrell wastes no time finding an advantage; Ivy and Ivy Jr. clean up with their locker; Kenny gets some advice from a music legend; Shana and Edwina settle for thrifting what's in front of them.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Hesperia, Calif., Mary's transportation troubles lead to her teaming up with Kenny and taking him out to pasture; Darrell shows the next generation of Gambler how it's done; the Vegas Ladies' mid-century style lets them write their own ticket.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: It's all in the family in Moreno Valley, Calif., as Emily brings along her cowboy husband; Ivy is displeased at Mary's fraternization with the auctioneer; Kenny looks for anything in his locker that can wash off that storage scent.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell has a completely groovy time in Van Nuys, Calif.; Ivy starts his day off with an unwelcome bang; Brandi and Jarrod are left wondering whether their unit will bring clear skies or clouds ahead.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Winds in excess of 30 mph batter Desert Hot Springs, Calif., and the buyers do their best to keep standing; Rene and Gunther dust off an old locker; Brandi and Jarrod's unit takes a turn and ends up lapping the competition; Kenny steps up his game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy brings his son to Moreno Valley, where good things always happen, and leaves with yo-yo's of an unexpected kind; Rene and Casey discover that their shoes are more "air" and less "Jordan."

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny treats Perris, Calif., like a European vacation, picking up women along the way; Jarrod's lousy locker doesn't offer him any protection; Rene's tools end up being older than he expects.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The gang is on final approach in Riverside; Darrell listens to his sports sense, and it pays off; Ivy and Ivy get distracted by a decoy but manage to find the bills in the end; Brandi tries to teach Danielle a lesson about the true meaning of trash.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A confident Kenny has a three-step plan for success in Stanton, Calif.; Darrell helps Kimber find winning items for her new boutique; Rene brings Casey, who needs a distraction; Laura takes lead as auctioneer, while Dan holds the clipboard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny's fear of sharks inspires a controversial wardrobe choice; Rene brings his bargain army along to try and intimidate the competition while he gets his slice of the loot; Darrell won't take no for an answer, moving full-steam ahead.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa decides to be fact-based in Placentia, Calif., inadvertently complicating international relations; Ivy and his son conjure up a locker with some mysterious sports equipment; Rene won't be taken advantage of, allowing him to record a nice win.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi does everything she can to stay positive; Darrell finds a unit with some vintage totes, while Gunter plays on Rene's last nerve.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition is taken to a whole new level when Jase and Willie challenge Alan and Jep to a survival race through the woods on Phil's property.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival -- Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich for his Duck Diner menu, and enlists the help of the ladies to be his "taste testers."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fiancé Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the gang split a nearly perfect 1960 Willys Jeep into four pieces to make it longer, wider and meaner.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: After John Cena makes a surprise appearance at the shop, Bill and the guys begin to customize John's small 1969 MGC to be a perfect fit; a new customer wants a handmade lifted suspension on his 1920 Denali 2500 as a gift for his wife.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill is still being put to the test with a 1928 Ford Rat Rod, a 1942 Ford pickup and a 1975 C10.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill has never really liked the body of the 1974 Cadillac Eldorado, but when a client wants hers radically redesigned, Ekstensive blends old and new to make it cooler than the rest.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the team work their magic to customize a brand-new 2022 International wrecker; now that the pristine 1960s Willys Jeep has been quartered, they use imaginative fabrication techniques to make it whole again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: An Ekstensive favorite, a 2001 Hummer H1, needs some serious reinforcements; Bill changes things up on his completely custom, all-tube buggy by borrowing technology from monster trucks; Bill puts his daughter to work customizing her 2020 Challenger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Actor John Cena is amazed by the transformation of his British classic '69 MGC into a custom-built masterpiece with all-American trimmings; the team has to get creative building a chassis and bed for a '60s Jeep Willys entirely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The Mecum Auction comes to town, and Bill runs four vehicles across the block with shocking results. The team starts their next monster build, a custom all-tube buggy. Building an indestructible cage requires all their fabrication skills and then some!

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The hometown Houston Astros ask for a custom van that brings the party.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '68 C10 gets over-the-top fabrication and an epoxy river bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill refuses to hold anything back as the '68 C10 finishes in a flourish.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team custom builds every part for the heavy-duty, 1,500-hp buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A pristine '60s Willys transforms into something bigger, meaner and louder.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and team go big with an antique '53 tanker and small with a golf cart.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The crew takes a fully customized '37 Ford Coupe back to the factory look.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '64 Rolls-Royce has a rusty secret, and the '53 tanker is almost done.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team turns an F-350 into a Baja-style Raptor and rebuilds a '64 Rolls.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team upgrades a '72 'Cuda's interior and tears down a '52 GMC wrecker.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill wakes up his F-150 race truck, and the wrecker gets new suspension.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '22 Ford Lighting becomes the shop's first all-electric custom air ride.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Builds include a smashed '22 Gladiator and a Polaris Ranger side-by-side.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill goes back to his roots building mini-trucks with a 2023 Polaris Ranger, adding a custom camper and dancing bed; Ekstensive has built its share of ground-up builds over the years, but nothing like the metalwork on the 1952 Wrecker.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: What was already one of Ekstensive's biggest ground-up builds ever goes even bigger on the '52 tow truck, as Bill and his team fabricate a custom hot rod wrecker truck unlike any other; the team takes the stock out of a 2023 GMC Denali.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: John Cena surprises the shop with parts of an iconic '37 Bugatti Type 57; it's Bill's turn to surprise John with an audacious design choice; a stock '23 GMC Denali goes bigger, badder and dually.

programme.desc: The race is on to make it to Prudhoe before a wicked storm turns fierce.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Only in Dog's world would a bantam fighting cock, a pregnant daughter, and a jungle safe house go together. And don't forget the mopeds as well a group of hostile squatters on government land! They're all part of the hunt for an elusive criminal.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There are few louder wake-up calls than coming-to in a jail cell with no idea how you got there. Add the media splashing the news of your arrest on every TV channel, and if your name is Lyssa Chapman you know you are in for a rough day.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For months, this fugitive has been stringing Leland along with a series of barely believable excuses. Out of patience, Leland calls in the Big Dog. The team whole team heads out to put pressure on the family and friends of this imposing 300-pound felon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog finds himself looking for more than one fugitive. He starts the day looking for a woman who has skipped out on her court date.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Dog decides to spend the day caring for his newest granddaughter, Beth enlists the girls to hunt down a female fugitive. Heading into a dangerous part of town the ladies will use their feminine wiles to track this mother gone wrong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This one is close to home. Dog's target on today's hunt is the cousin of Kali, Garry Boy's caregiver. In addition she has a reputation as a brawler. With Duane Lee still missing from the team Baby Lyssa decides she will step-up in this hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There is a running joke in the posse that every time Bobby Brown asks them for help with a fugitive he always promises them that it's "an easy one," but the hunts end up being epic searches.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Other than bringing criminals to justice, one of Dog's loves is teaching the next generation of bounty hunters the tricks of the trade. Today he has a new student.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and today they face a special Chapman challenge--getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.desc: Cecily has graduated from High School and Dog believes the time is right to show her what the family business is all about. The rough and tumble world of bounty hunting is very different than the all girls private school.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kolani's on the run, left his wife to look after four kids and left Dog holding the bag for the $10k bond. Apparently the lure of the streets and other women have drawn him away from his commitments.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take time from their busy schedule to thank their fans by inviting them into their home to celebrate the holiday season. But when Dog decides he needs to help his son Garry believe in Santa Claus again the plan changes.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Colorado chasing a young man with a taste for trouble. He's fled to Texas but with his family's house on the line Dog is willing to try a risky strategy. He enlists the family in an elaborate hoax to lure the runner home.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is always trying to reduce the number of fugitives in Hawaii, so he really doesn't like felons from the mainland combining their flight from the law with an island vacation.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With twelve kids of his own Dog knows how hard it is to keep children on the straight and narrow, especially during their turbulent teens.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.
